meanings.def: the part of a phone that you hold close to your mouth and ear
examples: to pick up/lift/put down/replace the receiver
‘It's your mother on the phone again!’, said John with his hand over the receiver.
He covered the receiver and mouthed, ‘It's him.’
He slammed the receiver down and burst into tears.
She picked up the receiver and put it to her ear.
She took a deep breath and lifted the receiver off its hook.
The receiver was dangling from the payphone.

meanings.def: a piece of radio or television equipment that changes broadcast signals into sound or pictures
examples: To change channel, select the desired number on the receiver unit.

meanings.def: a person who is chosen by a court to be in charge of a company that is bankrupt
examples: They had to lay off 200 staff and call in the receivers.
The company has been put in the hands of the receiver.
A receiver was appointed by the court to handle the company’s affairs.
The company remained in the hands of the receiver.
Molly's more of a giver than a receiver.

meanings.def: a person who buys or accepts stolen goods, knowing that they have been stolen
a player who plays in a position in which the ball can be caught when it is being passed forward
